definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He was also a famous book collector and epigrapher in Shantong area during Qian Long period.
sentences.chinese: 他也是乾隆朝山东著名的藏书家及金石学家。

sentences.english: This part explores the influence of Epigraphy of Qing Dynasty on the practice of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，宏观探讨清代金石学对书法实践的影响。

sentences.english: Epigraphy became a special discipline, and made great achievement in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 金石学在宋代成为专门的学问，取得了很高的成就。

sentences.english: The Yuan and Ming Dynasty is a declining period in the course of the Epigraphy development.
sentences.chinese: 元明两代是金石学发展过程中的相对衰退期。

sentences.english: Part IV. This part explores the influence of Epigraphy of Qing Dynasty on the practice of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，宏观探讨清代金石学对书法实践的影响。

sentences.english: The eighth edition incorporates the latest archaeological and epigraphic research.
sentences.chinese: 第八版采用了最新的考古和金石学研究。

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
a rubbing from a stone inscription
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
early form of Chinese characters inscribed in stone, a precursor of the small seal 小篆[xiao3 zhuan4]
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
